intro: Cynoglossum membranaceum, commonly known as Eastern blueweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-gray hue, while its flowers are clustered in dense spikes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing food for pollinators.
